The finding severity is based on an assessment of how easy it would be to compromise AWS resources if the issue is detected.

StandardsControlArn.documentation: The ARN of the security standard control.

Title.documentation: The title of the security standard control.

StandardsSubscription.documentation: A resource that represents your subscription to a supported standard.

StandardsInput.documentation: A key-value pair of input for the standard.

StandardsSubscriptionArn.documentation: The ARN of a resource that represents your subscription to a supported standard.

StandardsSubscriptionRequest.documentation: The standard that you want to enable.

StandardsArn.documentation: The ARN of the standard that you want to enable. To view the list of available standards and their ARNs, use the DescribeStandards operation.

StandardsInput.documentation: A key-value pair of input for the standard.

Comparison.documentation: The condition to be applied to a string value when querying for findings.

ResourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the resource to apply the tags to.

Tags.documentation: The tags to add to the resource.

ThreatIntelIndicator.documentation: Details about the threat intelligence related to a finding.

Category.documentation: The category of a threat intelligence indicator.

LastObservedAt.documentation: The date and time when the most recent instance of a threat intelligence indicator was observed.

Source.documentation: The source of the threat intelligence indicator.

SourceUrl.documentation: The URL to the page or site where you can get more information about the threat intelligence indicator.

Value.documentation: The value of a threat intelligence indicator.

ResourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the resource to remove the tags from.

TagKeys.documentation: The tag keys associated with the tags to remove from the resource.

ActionTargetArn.documentation: The ARN of the custom action target to update.

Description.documentation: The updated description for the custom action target.

Name.documentation: The updated name of the custom action target.

Filters.documentation: A collection of attributes that specify which findings you want to update.

RecordState.documentation: The updated record state for the finding.

Filters.documentation: The updated filters that define this insight.

GroupByAttribute.documentation: The updated GroupBy attribute that defines this insight.

InsightArn.documentation: The ARN of the insight that you want to update.

ControlStatus.documentation: The updated status of the security standard control.

DisabledReason.documentation: A description of the reason why you are disabling a security standard control.

StandardsControlArn.documentation: The ARN of the security standard control to enable or disable.

WafAction.documentation: Details about the action that CloudFront or AWS WAF takes when a web request matches the conditions in the Rule.

Type.documentation:
Specifies how you want AWS WAF to respond to requests that match the settings in a Rule.

Valid settings include the following:

  • ALLOW - AWS WAF allows requests

  • BLOCK - AWS WAF blocks requests

  • COUNT - AWS WAF increments a counter of the requests that match all of the conditions in the rule. AWS WAF then continues to inspect the web request based on the remaining rules in the web ACL. You can't specify COUNT for the default action for a WebACL.

WafExcludedRule.documentation: Details about a rule to exclude from a rule group.

RuleId.documentation: The unique identifier for the rule to exclude from the rule group.

WafOverrideAction.documentation: Details about an override action for a rule.

Type.documentation:
COUNT overrides the action specified by the individual rule within a RuleGroup .

If set to NONE, the rule's action takes place.

Workflow.documentation: Provides information about the status of the investigation into a finding.

Status.documentation:
The status of the investigation into the finding. The allowed values are the following.

  • NEW - The initial state of a finding, before it is reviewed.

  • NOTIFIED - Indicates that you notified the resource owner about the security issue. Used when the initial reviewer is not the resource owner, and needs intervention from the resource owner.

  • SUPPRESSED - The finding will not be reviewed again and will not be acted upon.

  • RESOLVED - The finding was reviewed and remediated and is now considered resolved.

WorkflowState.deprecatedMessage: This field is deprecated, use Workflow.Status instead.
